title: Subscription Economy & Auto-Pay

sections.title: Common Subscriptions
sections.content:
Many services use a subscription model (paying every month).

- **Subscription**: A regular payment for a service (Netflix, Spotify, Gym).
- **Monthly Fee**: The price you pay every month.
- **Annual / Yearly Fee**: The price you pay once a year.
- **Free Trial**: Using a service for free for a short time (e.g., 7 days).
- **Cancel**: To stop the service and the payments.

sections.title: Automatic Billing (Auto-Pay)
sections.content:
You can set up your bank to pay bills automatically.

- **Auto-Pay**: The bank sends the money automatically on a specific day.
- **Direct Debit**: An instruction to your bank to allow a company to take money.
- **Due Date**: The day you must pay the bill.
- **Renew**: To continue the subscription for another month/year.

sections.title: Subscription Cycle
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Start Free Trial] --> B[Trial Ends]
    B --> C{Cancel?}
    C -- No --> D[First Auto-Pay]
    D --> E[Monthly Service]
    E --> F[Next Billing Date]
    C -- Yes --> G[Service Stops]
```

objectives: Identify common subscription terms (Monthly, Annual, Trial)
Understand how 'Auto-Pay' works for regular bills
Learn basic phrases for starting or stopping a service

keyTerms.definition: An agreement to pay money regularly for a service.
A system where payments are made automatically.
A test period to try a product before buying it.
